014package org.jdbi.v3.core.locator.internal;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.Arrays;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.regex.Pattern;
020import java.util.stream.Collectors;
021
022import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
023import javax.annotation.Nullable;
024
025public class ClasspathBuilder {
026    private static final String DOT = ".";
027    private static final String SLASH = "/";
028
029    // a part can consist of already slash-concatenated parts
030    // preserving combined inputs can help see the bigger picture in debugging
031    private final List<String> parts = new ArrayList<>();
032    private String extension = null;
033
034    public ClasspathBuilder setExtension(@Nullable String extension) {
035        if (extension != null) {
036            String trimmed = extension.trim();
037            if (!trimmed.isEmpty()) {
038                this.extension = trimmed;
039            }
040        }
041        return this;
042    }
043
044    // org.foo.Bar$Inner -> org/foo/Bar$Inner
045    public ClasspathBuilder appendFullyQualifiedClassName(@Nonnull Class<?> clazz) {
046        return appendDotPath(clazz.getName());
047    }
048
049    // com.google.guava -> com/google/guava
050    public ClasspathBuilder appendDotPath(@Nonnull String path) {
051        return appendVerbatim(path.replace(DOT, SLASH));
052    }
053
054    // because sometimes you just don't have fancy data structures or patterns to work on
055    public ClasspathBuilder appendVerbatim(@Nonnull String s) {
056        return addCarefully(s);
057    }
058
059    private ClasspathBuilder addCarefully(@Nullable String part) {
060        String clean = sanitize(part);
061        if (clean != null) {
062            parts.add(clean);
063        }
064        return this;
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Returns the current classpath.
069     *
070     * @return the current classpath.
071     */
072    public String build() {
073        if (parts.isEmpty()) {
074            throw new IllegalStateException("specify path parts before building the path");
075        }
076
077        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
078        for (String part : parts) {
079            sb.append(part).append(SLASH);
080        }
081        sb.deleteCharAt(sb.length() - 1);
082        if (extension != null) {
083            sb.append(DOT).append(extension);
084        }
085        return sb.toString();
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * @return a readable representation of this builder â€” NOT the path string!
090     */
091    @Override
092    public String toString() {
093        return extension == null
094            ? parts.toString()
095            : parts.toString() + " + ." + extension;
096    }
097
098    @Nullable
099    private static String sanitize(String path) {
100        // these do not add levels to a path, so ignore them
101        if (path == null || path.isEmpty() || SLASH.equals(path)) {
102            return null;
103        }
104
105        // filter out common beauty flaws like double slashes or whitespace edges
106        String sanitized = Arrays.stream(path.split(Pattern.quote(SLASH)))
107            .map(String::trim)
108            .filter(part -> !part.isEmpty())
109            .collect(Collectors.joining(SLASH));
110
111        return sanitized.isEmpty() ? null : sanitized;
112    }
113}
